message_1: Suppose you have an input message consisting of 256 bits. You want to use a cryptographic hash function to produce an output hash of 128 bits. Find the number of possible output hashes that can be generated using this hash function.
message_2: A cryptographic hash function takes an input message and produces a fixed-size output hash. In this case, the output hash size is 128 bits. Since each bit can have 2 possible values (0 or 1), there are 2^128 possible output hashes that can be generated using this hash function.
